ovdesc.p: TheTAX.TYPE.CONDITION file links types of customer to types of tax thus enabling T24 to calculate different levels of tax depending on the type of customer. Using this mechanism, for example, it is possible to charge a different rate of VAT to residents and non-residents.
To activate this facility the user must first set up the different taxes on the TAX.TYPE file. An example of a tax on this file would be VAT, value added tax.

Secondly the user must establish the rules by which the different types of customer are to be determined. This is done firstly by establishing a record for TAX on the CONDITION.PRIORITY file. This record will indicate the fields on the customer that are to be examined when determining the type of customer for tax purposes. For example the user may decide that the customer's tax status can be identified from the SECTOR and RESIDENCE codes.

Thirdly the user must define the different types of customer by setting up the TAX.GEN.CONDITION file. For example the user may decide that 'private individuals' that are 'resident' are a type of customer for tax purposes.
Fourthly the user must define the different rates of tax that may be charged on the TAX table. For example the user may input records for VAT full rate and VAT reduced rate and VAT zero rate.

Finally the user links these different tables together on the TAX.TYPE.CONDITION table. At least one record will be established on this table for each TAX.TYPE. The record then links the types of customer with the tax rates to be applied. For example a single record may indicate that for VAT, resident individuals are to be charged 15%, all non-residents are to be charged 0%, etc.

More than one record may be set up on TAX.TYPE.CONDITION for each type of tax by the addition of a numeric sequence. Thus VAT may exist but also VAT-001. This facility is used where there are more than one set of rates for a particular tax, for example full rate value added tax and reduced rate value added tax.

The key of the the TAX.TYPE.CONDITION file is TAX.TYPE and product.

The former must exist on the TAX.TYPE file (e.g. VAT). The latter is optional and is an incremental number (e.g. VAT-001). It is used when more than one variation on a tax exists, for example value added tax at full rate and at reduced rate.

First part of field, tax.type, must exist on the tax type field. If a product is entered then this must be separated from the tax.type by a '-'. The product must be a number between 001 and 999 with leading zeros.`

Allows tax codes to be assigned to particular groups of contract as well as to the type of customer.

For example using this field and the customer charge conditions a specific tax code could be assigned to fixed deposits over a particular equivalent value for tax paying residents of a particular country.
The CONTRACT.GRP code is determined from the conditions defined in the APPL.GEN.CONDITION record for the relevant application.
